snippet: In his new book, the veteran food writer Peter Kaminsky writes that by maximizing flavor, you can satisfy your food cravings with smaller portions.
abstract: Veteran food writer Peter Kaminsky argues in his new book Culinary Intelligence: The Art of Eating Healthy (and Really Well) that food cravings can be satisfied by eating small portions of very flavorful foods.
lead_paragraph: In his new book, the veteran food writer Peter Kaminsky writes that by maximizing flavor, you can satisfy your food cravings with smaller portions.

headline.seo: The Author Peter Kaminsky on How to Eat Wisely
headline.main: Eating Well Without the Flavor of Shame
headline.print_headline: Eating Well Without the Flavor of Shame
